oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Homeward trip of the 1st Arkansas Regiment
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Handwritten account, "Homeward Trip of the 1st Ark. Regt. after the Surrender of the Tennessee Army, April 26, 1865," by Joseph Warren Van Meter. The month-long journey began on foot at Trinity, North Carolina, and ended "at home" in Arkansas on June 3. The men traveled also by train and steamer. Writer notes place names and miles covered per day. Joseph Warren Van Meter (1837-1903), Co. K, 7th Arkansas Infantry Regiment and Co. E, 1st Arkansas Infantry Regiment, CSA."
